EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hello {!Contact.FirstName},
Thank you for your business! We’ve received your purchase order {!Case.Customer_PO_RO_WONumber__c} and are anxious to get right to work on it.
But before we can start, we need your help. We need just a bit more information that was missing from your order.
<< Insert Z107 task long text notes>>
What's next:
Once we receive the missing information, we'll induct your unit into the shop. Then we'll complete a full analysis and verify the required repair. This typically takes us 3-5 days from receiving your missing information. If the work scope changes, we'll contact you immediately.
Questions? ____________________________________________________________________________________________
We’ll connect all of your inquiry details through the subject line of this email. So, when you reply, please leave the subject line unchanged to make sure your response is routed immediately to this case.
As you gather the missing information, here are a few answers to the most commonly asked questions:
1. When will I receive an estimated ship date? – Once we’ve received the missing information, your order will be confirmed and the estimate ship date will be available on the portal.
2. What's needed if the work scope changes? – We'll need you to amend your purchase order to match the updated work scope and price. Then just reply to this email and attach your document. Your unit will be placed on "hold" until we've contacted you and received your approval and amended purchase order.
3. How much time do I have to respond before my part is returned? – 10 days from when you receive the updated work scope. If we haven't heard from you, your unit will be returned in “as is” condition.
4. I've heard you now use flat rates for all your repairs. What's covered by a flat rate? – Flat rates include any minor modifications, service bulletins, and overhaul rework instructions that do not change the form, fit or function. The repair terms and conditions are available on the Honeywell MyAerospace.com portal.
Honeywell reserves the right to determine the ineligibility of repairs under the flat rate program if they are deemed to have "excessive" repair requirements and/or are beyond economical repair.
Thanks again! We’ll be on the lookout for your email.
Honeywell Aerospace Customer & Product Support Web: http://www.MyAerospace.com For 24/7 AOG: 1-800-601-3099 or internationally at 1-602-365-3099, option 4.
